gr.forth.ics.swkm.model2.util
Class DateTimeBase

java.lang.Object
  gr.forth.ics.swkm.model2.util.DateTimeBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
XMLDateTime
public abstract class DateTimeBase
extends Object
implements Serializable, Cloneable

60 * The base class for date/time XML Schema types. 61 *

62 * The validation of the date/time fields is done in the set methods and follows 63 * the ISO8601 Date and Time Format. 64 *

74

See Also:

144 * Returns true if the given year represents a leap year. A specific year is 145 * a leap year if it is either evenly divisible by 400 OR evenly divisible 146 * by 4 and not evenly divisible by 100. 147 * 148 * @param year 149 * the year to test where 0 < year <= 9999

setZone

public void setZone(short hour,
                    short minute)
424 * Sets the time zone fields for this date/time type. A call to this method 425 * means that the date/time type used is UTC. 426 *

427 * For a negative time zone, you first assign the absolute value of the time 428 * zone using this method and then you call 429 * setZoneNegative(boolean). 430 * 431 * @param hour 432 * The time zone hour to set. Must be positive. 433 * @param minute 434 * The time zone minute to set. 435 * @throws UnsupportedOperationException 436 * this exception is thrown when changing the value of the time 437 * zone fields is not allowed 438

isUTC

public boolean isUTC()
537 * Returns true if this date/time type is UTC, that is, has a time zone 538 * assigned. A date/time type is UTC if a 'Z' appears at the end of the 539 * lexical representation type or if it contains a time zone. 540 * 541 * @return true if this type has a time zone assigned, else false. 542

normalize

public void normalize()
761 * Normalizes a date/time datatype as defined in W3C XML Schema 762 * Recommendation document: if a timeZone is present but it is not Z then we 763 * convert the date/time datatype to Z using the addition operation defined 764 * in 766 * Adding Duration to dateTimes (W3C XML Schema, part 2 appendix E). 767 * 768 * @see #addDuration 769

compareTo

public int compareTo(DateTimeBase dateTime)
790 * Compares two date/time data types. The algorithm of comparison is defined 791 * in W3C XML Schema 792 * Recommendation (section 3.2.7.3) 793 *

794 * The returned value will be one of: 795 *

    796 *
  • INDETERMINATE (-1): this ? dateTime
    • 797 *
  • LESS_THAN (0): this < dateTime
    • 798 *
  • EQUALS (1): this == dateTime
    • 799 *
  • GREATER_THAN (2): this > dateTime
    • 800 *
801 *

802 * FIXME: This code does not compare time zones properly for date/time types 803 * that do not contain a time. 804 * 805 * @param dateTime 806 * the dateTime to compare with the current instance. 807 * @return the status of the comparison. 808
